item.title: [BEAM-6855] Side inputs are not supported when using the state API
item.summary: Side inputs are not supported when using the state API

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: I believe that the side-input code in SimplePushbackSideInputDoFnRunner needs to be implemented in StatefulDoFnRunner. kenn can you confirm?
This was definitely an issue at one time. I thought someone had addressed this, but perhaps not. It would be great to confirm and to add ValidatesRunner tests.
kenn it was never addressed. Can you confirm that the described solution is the correct one?

SimplePushBackSideInputDoFnRunner is a compositional block. It accepts a DoFnRunner that does the underlying processing. So you should be able to simply create a StatefulDoFnRunner and then pass it to the constructor of SimplePushBackSideInputDoFnRunner.
kenn shouldn't the DoFnRunner be replaced by StatefulDoFnRunner in SimplePushbackSideInputDoFnRunner as StatefulDoFnRunner  is the implementation of DoFnRunner?

What I mean is code something like this:

DoFnRunner statefulRunner = new StatefulDoFnRunner(...)
PushbackSideInputDoFnRunner dofnRunner = SimplePushbackSideInputDoFnRunner.create(statefulRunner, ...)

Thanks kenn

So, as per my understanding on your comment we have to only add test cases to validate StatefulDoFnRunner working with SimplePushbackSideInputDoFnRunner as it already supports dofnRunner. There will be no changes other than Test classes.

or as per my previous understanding based on title of Jira & first comment of reuvenlax is that with have to implement method sideInput(PCollectionView<T> view) in StatefulDoFnRunner just like in SimpleDoFnRunner.

Please verify my approach.

It is a good first step to test that StatefulDoFnRunner works as expected when it is combined with SimplePushbackSideInputDoFnRunner. Then you will want to test that the DirectRunner and other runners are creating these correctly.

I changed the component, since none of this is part of the SDK itself, but is just building blocks for runners to use however they want.

this is not resolved

To the best of my knowledge portable runners do support user state and side inputs in the DoFn as they rely on the FnApiDoFnRunner implementation which doesn't use the DoFnRunner variants found in runners-core.

After adding some testing, should we close this with use a portable runner?

I would leave this open. Since most users are still on non-portable runners, someone may choose to pick it up and fix it. It is on the more challenging end of "starter" I would say, since all the needed DoFnRunner implementations exist and need to be composed.
